name: NSHelpManager
desc: An object for displaying online help for an app.

items.name: class var shared: NSHelpManager
items.desc: Returns the shared NSHelpManager instance, creating it if it does not already exist.

items.name: func find(String, inBook: NSHelpManager.BookName?)
items.desc: Performs a search for the specified string in the specified book.

items.name: func openHelpAnchor(NSHelpManager.AnchorName, inBook: NSHelpManager.BookName?)
items.desc: Finds and displays the text at the given anchor location in the given book.

items.name: func registerBooks(in: Bundle) -> Bool
items.desc: Registers one or more help books in the given bundle.

items.name: func setContextHelp(NSAttributedString, for: Any)
items.desc: Associates help content with an object.

items.name: func removeContextHelp(for: Any)
items.desc: Removes the association between an object and its context-sensitive help.

items.name: func contextHelp(for: Any) -> NSAttributedString?
items.desc: Returns context-sensitive help for an object.

items.name: func showContextHelp(for: Any, locationHint: NSPoint) -> Bool
items.desc: Displays the context-sensitive help for a given object at or near the point on the screen specified by a given point.

items.name: class let contextHelpModeDidActivateNotification: NSNotification.Name
items.desc: Posted when the application enters context-sensitive help mode. This typically happens when the user holds down the Help key.

items.name: class let contextHelpModeDidDeactivateNotification: NSNotification.Name
items.desc: Posted when the application exits context-sensitive help mode. This happens when the user clicks the mouse button while the cursor is anywhere on the screen after displaying a context-sensitive help topic.
